name: Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt
description:
Aldercourt City Council, in association with Sequre Transport Authority, welcome you into Aldercourt Station.

Aldercourt Station is a sprawling and expansive addition to London's Travel Network. Come get lost amonst its tile halls and take in the scenery as you pass through its liminal spaces.

It can be a little difficult to find your way through the station however - Follow the signs, keep your eyes open and you'll be just fine.

What is Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt?


Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt is a "walking simulator" anomaly spotting game, heavily inspired by creepy internet stories around the Backrooms, the concept of Liminal Spaces, and other games of this genre such as "The Exit 8".

In Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt, you will need to watch your surroundings for any changes (big or small) as you loop through the Station. Anything can change - Walls and windows can appear, gravity can change, people can act strangely... And your life could be in danger.

Play Time

The game features 40+ anomalies for players to find with an approx. playtime of 15 Mins - 2 Hours. Completionists may opt to find every anomaly.

Is Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt scary?

There are some mild jumpscares depending on how sensitive you are to sudden changes.

Is Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt a complete game?

Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt is a complete game. Some additional anomalies may be added in the future, but it is releasing feature-complete.

How does Midnight Monitor: Aldercourt tie into the Midnight Monitor series?

The security firm "Sequre" featured through Midnight Monitor: Anomaly Watch features again in this game with some small callbacks to "Anomaly Watch". The plan is to continue growing the Midnight Monitor ethos as the series grows.
